excerpt: Large museum next to a Roman site & containing collections of archaeological finds & modern art.
detail_description: The Valkhof Museum in Nijmegen is a large museum located next to a Roman site. It houses collections of archaeological finds and modern art, making it an ideal destination for history enthusiasts and art lovers alike. The museum boasts an impressive collection of Roman artifacts and strives to keep its exhibitions up-to-date with the current world narrative. Visitors can also enjoy the museum's stunning building and park, both accessible to the public.
name: Valkhof Museum

excerpt: Scenic green space with a pond established in the 19th century around a medieval defense structure.
detail_description: Kronenburgerpark is a picturesque green space with a pond that dates back to the 19th century and surrounds a medieval defense structure. Visitors can explore the Valkhof Museum's Roman artifacts and stroll through the historic city center, taking in landmarks like St. Stevenskerk. Outdoor enthusiasts can enjoy cycling and hiking in the surrounding Ooijpolder nature reserve. The park also offers a play area for children, two beautiful lakes, and various animal species to admire.
name: Kronenburgerpark

excerpt: Wooded area with ancient Roman ruins, a chapel, scenic river views & various seasonal festivals.
detail_description: Valkhof Park is a picturesque public park located on the edge of the river Waal in Nijmegen. Situated on a small hill, it offers stunning views of the river and the city. The park is home to ancient Roman ruins, including a garrison built in the first century BC, as well as remnants of buildings from various historical periods.
name: Valkhof Park

excerpt: Venue recreating the experience of the blind or visually impaired,  including 1hr tours in the dark.
detail_description: muZIEum is a unique museum experience located in Nijmegen that immerses visitors in the world of those who are blind or visually impaired. Here, you can embark on an enlightening journey through complete darkness, guided by knowledgeable instructors. Before entering the pitch-black exhibition space, guests learn to navigate using canes and spend time understanding how to move without sight.
name: muZIEum

excerpt: Centuries-old cobblestone thoroughfare lined with restaurants, boutiques & old buildings.
detail_description: Lange Hezelstraat is a historic cobblestone street in Nijmegen, the Netherlands, known for its centuries-old architecture and vibrant atmosphere. It is one of the oldest dedicated shopping streets in the country, offering a wide range of boutiques, restaurants, and old buildings. The street stretches from Kronenburgerpark to Ganzenheuvel and Houtstraat intersection.
name: Lange Hezelstraat

excerpt: Nijmegen is the largest city in the Dutch province of Gelderland and the ninth largest of the Netherlands as a whole. Located on the Waal River close to the German border, Nijmegen is one of the oldest cities in the Netherlands and the first to be recognized as such in Roman times. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Nijmegen, the largest city in the Dutch province of Gelderland and one of the oldest cities in the Netherlands, is situated on the Waal River near the German border. Recognized as a Roman town, it boasts historic sites like Saint Stephen's Church and Huis van de Nijmeegse Geschiedenis. The city played a significant role during Operation Market Garden when American forces aimed to secure bridges across the river Waal.
name: Nijmegen

detail_description: Stichting Stevenskerk Nijmegen is a historic church in the city of Nijmegen, Netherlands. It is known for its stunning architecture and rich history, dating back to the 13th century. The church has been beautifully restored and now serves as a cultural center, hosting concerts, exhibitions, and other events. Visitors can explore the church's interior, including its impressive organ and beautiful stained glass windows.
name: Stichting Stevenskerk Nijmegen

excerpt: Distinctive arched bridge over the Waal River with a memorial to WWII's Operation Market Garden.
detail_description: Waalbrug is a remarkable arched bridge that spans the Waal River and serves as a memorial to WWII's Operation Market Garden. This monumental structure, with a length of 604m and an arch reaching 65m in height, was opened by Queen Wilhelmina in 1936. It holds great significance for Dutch road traffic and offers stunning views of the river, the rail bridge, the port, and Nijmegen city's skyline.
name: Waalbrug

detail_description: Located in the heart of Nijmegen on the Grote Markt, De Waagh is housed in one of the city's most beautiful buildings. This versatile venue has served various purposes over the years and now offers a delightful dining experience. Whether you're looking for a pleasant lunch spot or a sunny terrace to enjoy drinks, De Waagh has it all. Additionally, In De Kazerne, situated in an old barracks, provides cozy indoor and outdoor spaces for a leisurely afternoon or evening.
name: De Waagh

excerpt: Large collection of bicycles with an emphasis on historic ones from before 1900, plus memorabilia.
detail_description: The Café Velocitas is a remarkable museum that showcases an extensive assortment of bicycles, with a particular emphasis on antique models predating the 1900s. The establishment also features an impressive array of memorabilia related to cycling history. This museum is definitely worth a visit for those seeking to explore early bicycle technology and its evolution over time.
name: Nationaal Fietsmuseum Velorama

detail_description: The Honigcomplex, situated in the former Honig factory in Nijmegen, has been transformed into a vibrant hub for cultural and craft businesses. This industrial space is now home to a diverse range of enterprises including coffee roasters, microbreweries, art galleries, designer furniture shops, and even a chocolate bar. The complex also hosts various expositions, restaurants, concerts, and parties. It's conveniently located near the city center by the river and offers ample parking space.
name: Honigcomplex

detail_description: Kinderboerderij de Goffert is a charming educational farm located in the heart of Nijmegen's greenery, adjacent to Goffertpark. The recently renovated farm offers a variety of farm animals such as donkeys, horses, goats, sheep, pigs, and deer. Visitors can also purchase fresh fruits, vegetables, and flowers grown on-site. The farm features picnic areas and a playground for children to enjoy.
name: Kinderboerderij de Goffert
address: Slotemaker de Bruïneweg 268, 6532 AD Nijmegen, Netherlands

excerpt: Craft brewery & distillery in a 12th-century building, plus a museum with tastings & a restaurant.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Nijmegen, Brouwerij de Hemel is a charming craft brewery and distillery that boasts a rich history dating back to the 12th century. Housed within the historic Commanderie van Sint Jan, which once served as a monastery for knights, this brewery has been delighting beer enthusiasts for over three decades. Visitors can embark on guided tours during weekends to delve into its intriguing past and learn about traditional brewing methods.
name: Brouwerij de Hemel

excerpt: Relaxed eatery with a terrace serving finger foods & typical pub grub, plus tea & regional beer.
detail_description: De Hemel is a charming eatery located in the heart of Nijmegen, housed in the historic Commanderie van St. Jan. This relaxed restaurant offers a unique dining experience with its focus on traditional pub grub and self-brewed beers. Whether you choose to dine indoors under the heavy wooden beams or enjoy the lovely terrace, you can indulge in a variety of international cuisines alongside Dutch specialties.
name: De Hemel

detail_description: Grote Markt is the vibrant heart of Nijmegen, surrounded by magnificent palaces, historic buildings, and lively entertainment venues. It serves as a perfect starting point for exploring the city and offers a picturesque riverside promenade. The square is overlooked by the stunning 17th-century Waagh building, now home to an elegant restaurant.
name: Grote Markt

excerpt: Upscale restaurant in a 14th-century building, offering inventive farm-based fare & tasting menus.
detail_description: Restaurant De Nieuwe Winkel is a hidden gem located in a former 14th-century orphanage in the heart of Nijmegen. This upscale restaurant offers an innovative farm-based menu with a focus on botanical gastronomy, utilizing a variety of edible plants to create unique and sustainable dishes. Chef Emile van der Staak's dedication to sustainability and the future of food is reflected in the predominantly plant-based, organic, and seasonal offerings.
name: Restaurant De Nieuwe Winkel
address: Gebroeders van Limburgplein 7, 6511 BW Nijmegen, Netherlands

detail_description: Bistrobar Berlin, located just outside Nijmegen's city center, is a vibrant restaurant known for its modern and daring cuisine. The menu, curated in collaboration with renowned advisor Ron Blaauw, offers an eclectic mix of international flavors. The restaurant has garnered praise for its skilled and friendly service as well as high-quality food and well-paired wines. Embodying the open-mindedness of Berlin, the restaurant exudes an atmosphere of creativity and connection.
name: Bistrobar Berlin

detail_description: Radboud University Nijmegen, established in 1923 as the first Catholic university in the Netherlands, offers a range of educational institutions including vocational, intermediate, and secondary schools. The university is renowned for its Molecular and Laser Physics Department with excellent research facilities and a conducive environment. Additionally, it houses the prestigious Radboud University Medical School. The campus's proximity to the city center and amenities like Albertheijn XL make it an attractive choice for prospective students.
name: Radboud University Nijmegen

detail_description: The Shamrock Irish Pub in Nijmegen offers a traditional Irish bar experience with the aroma of beer, fresh snacks, and a lively atmosphere. It's a popular spot for sports enthusiasts to catch football matches on big TV screens while enjoying drinks. The pub has a cozy ambiance and is frequented by local fans during away matches, adding to the vibrant atmosphere.
name: The Shamrock Irish Pub

detail_description: The Museum of Anatomy and Pathology, located within the Radboudumc study centre, provides visitors access to both the Department of Anatomy and the Department of Pathology. The museum houses a diverse collection which includes embryos, fetuses, and various human body parts. This educational exhibition offers enlightening medical histories alongside unsettling anatomical specimens. Video displays add valuable historical context to the exhibits. Admission is free; however, emotional demands are placed on visitors in the section dedicated to childbirth and defects.
name: Museum of Anatomy and Pathology
address: Geert Grooteplein Noord 21, 6525 EZ Nijmegen, Netherlands

detail_description: LUX is Nijmegen's largest arthouse cinema, offering a diverse range of international and independent films. It also serves as a cultural hub with spaces for live performances, food, and public talks. The cinema features seven modern screening rooms that can accommodate around 800 visitors. In addition to cinematic programming, LUX hosts various events throughout the week, including live debates on culture or politics and avant-garde dance performances.
name: LUX

detail_description: Waalkade in Nijmegen is a picturesque spot that offers various activities for visitors. You can leisurely stroll along the area, enjoy the outdoor terraces, explore museums, try your luck at Holland Casino, or simply unwind on the lush greens. It's a versatile destination with something for everyone to enjoy.
name: Waalkade

detail_description: Located in the heart of Nijmegen, Mariënburg Kapel is a medieval monument dating back to the late Middle Ages. Also known as the 'House of Nijmegen History,' it serves as a starting point for those interested in delving into the history of the oldest city in the Netherlands. Originally built in 1431 and named Mons Maria, this chapel now hosts various exhibitions and is referred to as the House of History.
name: Mariënburg Kapel

detail_description: Fika is a Swedish tradition that involves gathering for coffee, pastries, and conversation. Fika Cafe in Nijmegen embraces this custom with offerings like mimosa breakfasts, traditional smorrebrod sandwiches, and high-wine with fika snack platters. The cafe's Scandinavian-inspired decor adds to the experience, transporting visitors to Copenhagen or Stockholm. Fika serves not just ordinary sandwiches but smorrebrod - multi-grain bread topped with typical Scandinavian ingredients.
name: Fika

excerpt: Church from 1243, restored after bombing, with an 18th-century organ & a tower for city views.
detail_description: Saint Stephen's Church in Nijmegen is a historic church dating back to 1243, which was restored after being bombed. It features an impressive 18th-century organ and a tower that offers panoramic views of the city. The church's inclusive attitude is evident through its free photo exhibition with transgender themes, showcasing acceptance and love for all. Visitors can admire the beautiful interior and exterior of the church, including displays such as Christmas figurines and a tree filled with children's prayer requests.
name: Saint Stephen's Church, Nijmegen

excerpt: Nature & history museum in a 1500s defensive tower, with exhibits on the Waal River & Nijmegen city.
detail_description: De Bastei is a museum and nature center located in Nijmegen, the oldest city in the Netherlands. Housed in a 1500s defensive tower, it offers exhibits on the Waal River and the city's history. Visitors can explore the flora and fauna of the Gelderse river area through a beautiful collection of plants, animals, and stones at the visitors' center.
name: De Bastei

detail_description: The Petrus Canisiuskerk is an exquisite contemporary church that initially appears to be constructed from a Roman temple. It follows the Catholic faith and offers a tranquil ambiance, complemented by soothing musical melodies playing softly in the background. This place of worship is worth visiting, situated within the town's vicinity.
name: Petrus Canisiuskerk

detail_description: Besiendershuis is an exquisite and unique site brimming with historical significance, where a benevolent organization orchestrates captivating initiatives and gatherings. It operates at the innovative intersection of history, culture, and contemporary societal affairs. Nestled in a secluded alleyway, this place offers a mesmerizing ambiance that beckons visitors to explore its charm. Although access inside might be restricted, it is still worthwhile to pay a visit and immerse oneself in the intangible essence that pervades the surroundings.
name: Besiendershuis

excerpt: Leafy expanse with a petting zoo, an outdoor concert hall & the stadium of NEC Nijmegen soccer team.
detail_description: Goffertpark in Nijmegen is a sprawling park that offers various terrains for recreational activities. It features a charming petting zoo with farmyard animals and the NEC Goffertstadion, the city's largest football stadium which hosts open-air music events and concerts during warmer months. The park comprises grassy hills and wide footpaths, ideal for cycling, jogging, or hiking. It's a perfect escape from the city where visitors can relax and enjoy nature.
name: Goffertpark Nijmegen
address: Unnamed Road, Muntweg 442, 6532 TP Nijmegen, Netherlands

name: Foundation Hortus Nijmegen
address: Victor Westhofflaan 22, d'Almarasweg 22d, 6525 DK Nijmegen, Netherlands

detail_description: Rivierpark Nijmegen Waal is a stunning area along the Waal River. It offers a beautiful landscape where visitors can enjoy leisurely walks on the Lentse Warande, taking in the breathtaking view. This park provides a refreshing change from the usual North Sea beach setting and pleasantly surprises its guests with its charming location. The atmosphere is incredibly pleasant, creating an inviting ambiance for everyone to enjoy.
name: Rivierpark Nijmegen Waal

detail_description: Tati is a beloved restaurant in Nijmegen-Oost, known for its retro look and vibrant interior. The menu is filled with vegan dishes, offering options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner such as smoked mushroom tacos. The cozy atmosphere of Tati reflects a homely feel that complements the 100% vegan kitchen.
name: Tati

detail_description: Down Town is a popular coffee, breakfast, and lunch spot located in Nijmegen. Tucked away in a side street near the market square, this cozy and stylish venue offers photogenic surroundings with beautiful large windows and an old building. The menu features delicious brunch items such as croissants with smashed avocado, bread with tuna melt, and pulled jackfruit. With its hip ambiance reminiscent of Paris or New York, Down Town provides a great place to enjoy quality food and friendly service.
name: DOWN TOWN

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Nijmegen, Restaurant Vesters is a charming spot that beautifully marries classic and contemporary cuisine. With a strong emphasis on organic and local ingredients, this intimate eatery has been dedicated to creating dishes that strike the perfect balance for over a decade. The knowledgeable staff encourages guests to indulge in their expertly curated wine pairings alongside their meals. Vesters offers an inviting atmosphere where laughter and good company are always welcome.
name: Restaurant Vesters

detail_description: De Meesterproef, nestled within the historic Honigcomplex in Nijmegen, is a vibrant venue that beautifully marries industrial charm with culinary artistry. Once a hub for mass-produced food items, this space has transformed into a cultural hotspot where traditional cooking techniques like pickling and smoking take center stage. Guests can indulge in meticulously crafted dishes made from carefully selected ingredients, all while enjoying the scenic views along the Waal River.
name: De Meesterproef | ruimte voor evenementen

detail_description: SPAR city Nijmegen offers a great selection of fresh and affordable food items. Customers can enjoy a Monday deal on smoothies for just 1 euro, even late in the day. The store also provides a variety of baked goods and fresh sandwiches at very reasonable prices. While it may be small, it's an excellent spot to find quality products and little essentials.
name: SPAR city Nijmegen

detail_description: Nijmegen, a historic city in the southeast of the Netherlands, is known for its rich Roman history and vibrant cultural atmosphere. The city boasts impressive landmarks dating back to the Roman Empire era, including an imposing 6-meter-high Roman mask on Veur-Lent island. Nijmegen is also home to Radboud University, contributing to its lively student life and hosting various events and festivals throughout the year.
name: Nijmegen

detail_description: Explore the Grote Markt and marvel at the stunning Boterwaag, a magnificent structure situated in the center of the square, adorned with Renaissance motifs. This picturesque square boasts an exquisite architectural design characterized by its intricacy and attention to detail. In a post-pandemic era, the charming cafes surrounding this historical gem are sure to attract hordes of visitors eager to indulge in their offerings.
name: Boterwaag

excerpt: Laid-back hostel offering simple rooms & dorms, plus a rooftop terrace & a lounge.
detail_description: Barbarossa is a newly opened hostel located in the heart of the city, making it an ideal choice for budget travelers. The staff is known for being friendly and accommodating, and the rooms are kept clean. The hostel offers simple accommodations including private rooms and dorms. Guests can enjoy a rooftop terrace and a lounge area during their stay. The location is praised for its proximity to downtown restaurants, bars, and other attractions. Additionally, guests appreciate the modern furnishings and cleanliness of the renovated rooms.
name: Barbarossa

detail_description: Museum Van Lymborch Brothers House is a small museum dedicated to the renowned Van Lymborch Brothers, Dutch medieval miniature painters who had their studio here around 1400. The museum offers guided tours that delve into the history of art and the predecessors of the Northern Renaissance, including Jan van Eyck. Visitors can explore the stories behind these influential artists and their impact on painting, making it a unique and enriching experience.
name: Museum Van Lymborch Brothers House

detail_description: Playground The Leemkuil is a popular destination in Nijmegen, located in the southeastern part of the city. It's easily accessible by car with free parking available nearby on Luciaweg. This playground has been around for 75 years and offers a wide range of activities for both kids and adults. There are climbing structures and play equipment for older children, while younger ones can enjoy low-height play items.
name: Playground The Leemkuil

excerpt: 25,000-capacity stadium that's home to Dutch professional soccer club Nijmegen Eendracht Combinatie.
detail_description: The 25,000-seat venue housing the Dutch professional soccer team Nijmegen Eendracht Combinatie (N.E.C.) pleasantly surprised visitors during a second division match with its fantastic fan support. The game itself was enjoyable, as were the hot dogs, despite the inconvenience of having to load money onto the NEC Nijmegen season card for purchases instead of using cash or personal debit cards.
name: N.E.C.

detail_description: Playground Brakkefort is an excellent destination for families with children. It offers a wide range of entertaining activities that won't break the bank. From slides and swings to jungle gyms and various play structures, there are plenty of options for kids to enjoy. They can also engage in water play, jump on a large cushion or trampoline, among other things. With ample space, benches, picnic areas, and even a cafeteria available, parents can relax while their children have fun.
name: Playground Brakkefort
